title: Pasazerka aka Passenger (1963 - Poland) [Auschwitz] multi subs
description:
PasaÅ¼erka (1963 - Poland)                                       aka Passenger

Drama / History / War

director . . . . Andrzej Munk, Witold Lesiewicz
 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0054159/


Cannes Film Festival - NOMINATED - Palme d'Or
Cannes Film Festival - WON - Special Mention
Venice Film Festival - WON - Pasinetti Award


filmed at Auschwitz-Birkenau Concentration Camp, Oswiecim, Malopolskie, Poland

A former guard in the women's section of Auschwitz encounters a passenger on a cruise ship who was one of her prisoners. This sets off a series of flashbacks concerning those terrible days, and the struggle of wills that took place between prisoner and guard.

In 1961, while shooting Pasazerka, director Munk was killed in a car crash. His friend Witold Lesiewicz spent two years editing the footage and adding still photography and voice-over narration. Strange and fragmentary, Pasazerka is a compelling exploration of hangman's psychology, loaded with unanswered questions about the reliability of memory and the human need for exculpation.

Described as one of the most audacious fictions ever made about the Holocaust, Pasazerka is a classic of Polish cinema. Pasazerka captures, arguably better than any other film, a sense of horrifying blankness, a matter-of-fact degradation, which conveys something of what the experience of Auschwitz might have been like.


Video: XviD, 640x368, 25.000 fps, 1585 Kbps, 00h58m07s
